commit_message:
Maintain specs of approved and completed of Antelop version

Change-Id: I821474c6e8c19765b68cc35d5a4822c8c89e9919
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cyborg-specs refs/changes/52/877152/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================= Add disable/enable device API ============================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-cyborg/+spec/disable-enable-device Nowadays, Cyborg discovers the device on compute node by each driver. All devices matching the spec of driver are discovered and reported to the Placement service as an accelerator resources. This spec proposes a set of new APIs which allow admin users to disable/enable a device. Problem description =================== Cyborg maintains a configuration file to configure the enabled drivers. Once the driver is enabled, the agent will discover all devices whose vendor ID, device ID match the driver's requirement. If admin user do not want all devices to be used by virtual machine, there is no way to disable a device currently. Use Cases --------- * Alice is an admin user, she wants some FPGAs to be reserved for its own use and not allow them to be allocated to a VM at the time. For example, she wants to program the FPGA device and use it as the OVS agent running on the host. Proposed change =============== We propose to add new API in order to enable/disable a device. If the device is disabled, Cyborg will report this device as a reserved resource to Placement, so that Nova can not schedule to this device. On the contrary, if the device is enabled, the device should become available and the 'reserved' field in Placement shoule be set to 0. * Since the API layer is modified, a new microversion should be introduced. * It also need a new field "is_maintaining" in Device object and data model to indicate whether the device is disbaled. If one device is disabled, the "is_maintaining" field should be set to "True", and if the device is enabled, the field should be set to "False". The default value should be "False". * Cyborg need call Placement API to update the "reserved" field for the device in this API. * Add "is_maintaining" field's value check during conductor's periodic report. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- A new column `is_maintaining` should be added in Device's data model. REST API impact --------------- A microversion need to be introduced since the Device API changed. List Device API ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ * Return a device list URL: ``/devices`` METHOD: ``GET`` Return: 200 .. code-block:: { "devices": [ { "uuid": "d2446439-0142-40b7-9eee-82d855f453d9", "type": "FPGA", "vendor": "0xABCD", "model": "miss model info", "std_board_info": "{"device_id": "0xabcd", "class": "Fake class"}", "vendor_board_info": "fake_vendor_info", "hostname": "devstack01", "links": [ { "href": "http://172.23.97.140/accelerator/v2/devices/d2446439-0142-40b7-9eee-82d855f453d9", "rel": "self" } ], "created_at": "2021-11-03T08:48:43+00:00", "updated_at": null } ] } Get Device API ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ * Get a device by uuid and return the details URL: ``/devices/{uuid}`` METHOD: ``GET`` Return: 200 .. code-block:: { "uuid": "d2446439-0142-40b7-9eee-82d855f453d9", "type": "FPGA", "vendor": "0xABCD", "model": "miss model info", "std_board_info": "{"device_id": "0xabcd", "class": "Fake class"}", "vendor_board_info": "fake_vendor_info", "hostname": "devstack01", "links": [ { "href": "http://172.23.97.140/accelerator/v2/devices/d2446439-0142-40b7-9eee-82d855f453d9", "rel": "self" } ], "created_at": "2021-11-03T08:48:43+00:00", "updated_at": null } Disable Device API ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ * Disable a device URL: ``/devices/disable/{device_uuid}`` METHOD: ``POST`` Return: 200 Error Code: 404(the device is not found),403(the role is not admin) Enable Device API ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ * Enable a device URL: ``/devices/enable/{device_uuid}`` METHOD: ``POST`` Return: 200 Error Code: 404(the device is not found),403(the role is not admin) Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- The deployer need update Cyborg to the microversion which supports disable/enable API. Otherwise the disable/enable API will be rejected. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Xinran Wang(xin-ran.wang@intel.com) Work Items ---------- * Add new column `is_maintaining` for device table. * Add disable/enable API in DeviceController. * Update the RP `reserved` field according to the operation. For `disable` oparation, the `reserved` field need be set by the same value as the `total` field, and for `enable` operation, the `reserved` field will be set to zero. * Update GET/LIST device API with `is_maintaining` field added in returned value. * Add disable/enable operation in cyborgclient. * Add unit tests. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Need add unit test, and tempest test if needed. Documentation Impact ==================== Need add related docs. References ========== None History ======= Optional section intended to be used each time the spec is updated to describe new design, API or any database schema updated. Useful to let reader understand what's happened along the time. .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Xena - Introduced * - Yoga - Reproposed

commit_message:
Maintain specs of approved and completed

Change-Id: Ic69868cb2cc67dabf6fe04b43ff2fa22f86bd933
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cyborg-specs refs/changes/51/877151/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================== Cyborg Xilinx FPGA Driver Proposal ================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-cyborg/+spec/add-xilinx-fpga-driver This spec proposes to provide the initial design for Cyborg's Xilinx FPGA driver. Problem description =================== We want to use Cyborg manage the Xilinx FPGA devices, but there is not driver for it, and we want to add the Xilinx FPGA driver to support managing Xilinx FPGA devices by Cyborg. Use Cases --------- * As an operator, I would like to use Cyborg agent starts or does resource checking periodically, the Cyborg Xilinx FPGA driver should provide ``discover()`` function to enumerate the list of the Xilinx FPGA devices, and report the details of all available Xilinx FPGA accelerators on the host, such as PID(Product id), VID(Vendor id), Device. * As a user, I would like to boot up a VM with Xilinx FPGA device. Cyborg should be able to manage this kind of acceleration resources, assign it to the VM(binding) and programming it. Proposed changes ================ Xilinx FPGA is PCIe based platform that is comprised of physical partitions called Shell and User. The Shell has two physical functions: privileged PF0 also called mgmt pf and non-privileged PF1 also called user pf. Shell provides basic infrastructure for the Alveo platform. User partition (otherwise known as PR-Region) contains user compiled binary.[1]_ User PF is only displayed after installing Xilinx driver `xrt`. And the difference between the PCI address of user PF and mgmt PF is the func field. For example, pci address of mgmt PF is '0000:3b:00.0', and the address of user PF is '0000:3b:00.1'. The func field increase 1. So the pci address of user PF can be calculated by the address of mgmt PF. This calculation rule also applies to 'product'. From the above description, the Xilinx FPGA driver should implement the following methods: - ``discover()``: This function works by executing ``lspci`` command and reports devices' raw info sample as following:: [ { "vendor": "10ee", "product": "5000", "device": "0000:3b:00.0" } ] In above example, "5000" is the mgmt PF. So the driver should add three traits for one device, including "CUSTOM_FPGA_<VENDOR_ID>", "CUSTOM_FPGA_PRODUCT_ID_<ID>". Also the driver should create records in deployable table only for the device. For now, only when both mgmt PF and user PF are binded to one vm, and end user can program the FPGA device. So there are two attach handles when binding it to vm. - ``program()``: This function works by executing ``xbmgmt program`` command which is included with the XRT installation package.[2]_ Also, this function should be called for pre-program before binding to vm. Below is the objects to describe a FPGA device which complies with the Cyborg database mode and Placement data model. :: Hardware Driver objects Placement data model | | | 1 FPGA 1 devices | | | | | 1 deployable ---> resource_provider | | ---> parent resource_provider: compute node | | | 1 FPGA 2 attach_handle ---> inventories(total:1) Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- Xilinx FPGA driver will not touch Data model. The Cyborg Agent can call Xilinx FPGA driver to update the database during the discover, bind and unbind operations. REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- * Add new driver xilinx_fpga_driver to enabled_drivers for agent. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Eric Xie Work Items ---------- * Implement Xilinx FPGA driver in Cyborg * Add related test cases. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======== * Unit tests will be added to test this driver. Documentation Impact ==================== Document Xilinx FPGA driver in Cyborg project. Test report in Cyborg wiki References ========== .. [1]: https://xilinx.github.io/XRT/master/html/platforms.html .. [2]: https://xilinx.github.io/XRT/master/html/xbmgmt2.html History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release - Description * - Yoga - Introduced

commit_message:
Migrate instance_name_template to the base class

The [DEFAULT] instance_name_template parameter is used not only by
nova-api but by other services like nova-conductor or nova-compute.
This change migrate the parameter from the api class to the base class
so that users can configure the parameter for all services.

Backport note:
This avoids deprecating the existing parameter in stable branch.

Change-Id: I0f590f12017e743a17d989d3a1008faa9b840e87
(cherry picked from commit 73eb553202e77ca3073764bb863cc07adc7f32c4)

longer need compatibility with Puppet 3.x (or even older).

added_lines: def test_list_devices_filter_by_combine_args(self): # list devices filter by combine args response = self.os_admin.cyborg_client.list_devices() type_name = response['devices'][0]['type'] vendor = response['devices'][0]['vendor'] hostname = response['devices'][0]['hostname'] params = { "type": type_name", "hostname": hostname, "vendor": vendor } response = self.os_admin.cyborg_client.list_devices(params=params) self.assertNotEmpty(response['devices']) for dv in response['devices']: self.assertEqual(type_name, dv['type']) self.assertEqual(vendor, dv['vendor']) self.assertEqual(hostname, dv['hostname'])

commit_message:
arq bind and unbound support vGPU

This patch is part of the vGPU support feature in cyborg.
It implements arq bind and unbind for vGPU resource.

Co-Authored-By: Wenping Song <songwenping@inspur.com>

Change-Id: I32c3b81345c6ce83834a83c64b88e37926724f16
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cyborg refs/changes/57/771757/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import json from cyborg.agent.rpcapi import AgentAPI # if attach_handle is a vgpu, create the mdev in the sys path if ah.attach_type == 'MDEV': attach_info = json.loads(ah.attach_info) pci_addr = "{}:{}:{}.{}".format( attach_info['domain'], attach_info['bus'], attach_info['device'], attach_info['function']) hostname = self.arq.hostname asked_type = attach_info['asked_type'] agent = AgentAPI() agent.create_mdev( context, hostname, pci_addr, asked_type, ah.uuid) hostname = arq.hostname if attach_handle.attach_type == 'MDEV': attach_info = json.loads(attach_handle.attach_info) pci_addr = "{}:{}:{}.{}".format( attach_info['domain'], attach_info['bus'], attach_info['device'], attach_info['function']) agent = AgentAPI() agent.remove_vgpu_mdev( context, hostname, pci_addr, attach_info['asked_type'], attach_handle.uuid)

added_lines: if [[ -d /etc/yum.repos.d/ ]]; then cp -r /etc/yum.repos.d/ ${LOG_DIR}/system_logs/ fi if [[ -d /etc/apt/sources.list.d/ ]]; then cp -r /etc/apt/sources.list.d/ ${LOG_DIR}/system_logs/ fi

commit_message:
Cyborg NVIDIA GPU Driver support vGPU management

The Cyborg NVIDIA GPU Driver has implemented pGPU management in
the Train release, this patch implements the vGPU management
support in the same driver. For specs about this feature, please
refer to [0].

[0]:https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/cyborg-specs/specs/wallaby/approved/vgpu-driver-proposal.html

Co-Authored-By: Wenping Song <songwenping@inspur.com>

implement blueprint enable-vgpu-in-cyborg

Change-Id: I715fdad3e8601186b5c6e8c087f27fb91d679490
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cyborg refs/changes/82/769482/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import six import sysNVIDIA_T4_GPU_INFO = "0000:af:00.0 3D controller [0302]: NVIDIA Corporation "\ "TU104GL [Tesla T4] [10de:1eb8] (rev a1)" NVIDIA_T4_SUPPORTED_MDEV_TYPES = ['nvidia-222', 'nvidia-223', 'nvidia-224', 'nvidia-225', 'nvidia-226', 'nvidia-227', 'nvidia-228', 'nvidia-229', 'nvidia-230', 'nvidia-231', 'nvidia-232', 'nvidia-233', 'nvidia-234', 'nvidia-252', 'nvidia-319', 'nvidia-320', 'nvidia-321'] BUILTIN = '__builtin__' if (sys.version_info[0] < 3) else '__builtins__' def readlines_T4(self): return [NVIDIA_T4_GPU_INFO] def test_discover_gpus_report_pGPU(self, mock_devices_for_vendor): @mock.patch('os.listdir') @mock.patch('os.path.exists') @mock.patch('cyborg.accelerator.drivers.gpu.utils.lspci_privileged') def test_discover_gpus_report_vGPU(self, mock_devices_for_vendor, mock_path_exists, mock_supported_mdev_types): vendor_id = '10de' mock_devices_for_vendor.return_value = self.p.stdout.readlines_T4() mock_path_exists.return_value = True mock_supported_mdev_types.return_value = NVIDIA_T4_SUPPORTED_MDEV_TYPES m = mock.mock_open(read_data='8') with mock.patch.object(six.moves.builtins, 'open') as mock_open: mock_open.side_effect = True yield m gpu_list = utils.discover_gpus(vendor_id, asked_type=['nvidia-223']) self.assertEqual(1, len(gpu_list)) attach_handle_list = [ {'attach_type': 'MDEV', 'attach_info': '{"asked_type": "nvidia-223", ' '"bus": "af", ' '"device": "00", ' '"domain": "0000", ' '"function": "0"}', 'in_use': False} ] * 8 attribute_list = [ {'key': 'rc', 'value': 'VGPU'}, {'key': 'trait0', 'value': 'CUSTOM_GPU_NVIDIA'}, {'key': 'trait1', 'value': 'CUSTOM_GPU_PRODUCT_ID_1EB8'}, ] expected = { 'vendor': '10de', 'type': 'GPU', 'std_board_info': {"controller": "3D controller", "product_id": "1eb8"}, 'vendor_board_info': {"vendor_info": "gpu_vb_info"}, 'deployable_list': [ { 'num_accelerators': 8, 'driver_name': 'NVIDIA', 'name': 'NVIDIA Corporation TU104GL ' '[Tesla T4]_0000:af:00.0', 'attach_handle_list': attach_handle_list, 'attribute_list': attribute_list }, ], 'controlpath_id': {'cpid_info': '{"bus": "af", ' '"device": "00", ' '"domain": "0000", ' '"function": "0"}', 'cpid_type': 'PCI'} } gpu_obj = gpu_list[0] gpu_dict = gpu_obj.as_dict() gpu_dep_list = gpu_dict['deployable_list'] gpu_attach_handle_list = \ gpu_dep_list[0].as_dict()['attach_handle_list'] gpu_attribute_list = \ gpu_dep_list[0].as_dict()['attribute_list'] attri_obj_data = [] [attri_obj_data.append(attr.as_dict()) for attr in gpu_attribute_list] attribute_actual_data = sorted(attri_obj_data, key=lambda i: i['key']) self.assertEqual(expected['vendor'], gpu_dict['vendor']) self.assertEqual(expected['controlpath_id'], gpu_dict['controlpath_id']) self.assertEqual(expected['std_board_info'], jsonutils.loads(gpu_dict['std_board_info'])) self.assertEqual(expected['vendor_board_info'], jsonutils.loads(gpu_dict['vendor_board_info'])) self.assertEqual(expected['deployable_list'][0]['num_accelerators'], gpu_dep_list[0].as_dict()['num_accelerators']) self.assertEqual(expected['deployable_list'][0]['name'], gpu_dep_list[0].as_dict()['name']) self.assertEqual(expected['deployable_list'][0]['driver_name'], gpu_dep_list[0].as_dict()['driver_name']) self.assertEqual(attach_handle_list[0], gpu_attach_handle_list[0].as_dict()) self.assertEqual(attribute_list, attribute_actual_data)

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2023.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2023.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: If7c27d978281817d022f6ecac276386cc7951fa8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/23/876323/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update master for stable/2023.1

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/2023.1.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/2023.1.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: If57c289b2e8e411504b187add037e7c1c1b0d54e

commit_message:
fix wrong error type in glance metadef tests

since xena the return type changed for some tests. See this commit message for the changes:
https://github.com/openstack/glance/commit/99331d7efacb556effc9dda2a7db06bdc6af0319
For this reason some patrole tests fail, because they await a 403 but now a 404 is send.

Change-Id: I2fe03fc3820b6c2e3679130ef2857eb740f4aaeb

commit_message:
WIP: Add a hacking check for policy names in one module only

This patchset adds a hacking check to Patrole to validate that
policy names are tested in one module only to avoid poor test
organization: a set of policies related to an API or to multiple
APIs should be tested together.

Change-Id: I1da694bd449d88626597dfc533c4dd6699879e85

added_lines: POLICY_NAME_RE = re.compile(r'.*rule\=[\'\"]{1}.*[\'\"]{1}') _HAVE_RBAC_DECORATOR = False _SEEN_POLICY_NAMES = {} global _HAVE_RBAC_DECORATOR _HAVE_RBAC_DECORATOR = True if not _HAVE_RBAC_DECORATOR: _HAVE_RBAC_DECORATOR = Falsedef unique_policy_tests_per_module(physical_line, filename): """Check that test cases don't use "self.client" to define a client. P104 """ if "patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api" in filename: if POLICY_NAME_RE.match(physical_line): try: candidate = POLICY_NAME_RE.findall(physical_line)[0].strip() policy_name = candidate.split('=')[-1].replace( '\"', '').replace('\'', '') except Exception: pass else: _SEEN_POLICY_NAMES.setdefault(policy_name, filename) other_filename = _SEEN_POLICY_NAMES[policy_name] # The same policy can be tested in a positive and negative test # module. if sum('_negative' in x for x in ( filename, other_filename)) == 1: return component = filename.split('/')[4] other_component = other_filename.split('/')[4] # The same policy can be tested across different components. # Do not assume different components have distinct policy # names. if component != other_component: return if filename != _SEEN_POLICY_NAMES[policy_name]: return 0, ("Each policy must be tested in one module only." " Policy: %s is tested in %s and %s. It should " "only be tested in one module." % ( policy_name, filename, _SEEN_POLICY_NAMES[policy_name])) register(unique_policy_tests_per_module)

commit_message:
Make rbac_utils is_admin more robust

This makes is_admin in rbac_utils more robust by doing
a context_is_admin check to determine admin-ness rather than
simply checking whether the RBAC role under test is the
admin role configured in Tempest.

Change-Id: I544b228b3e0896c93c601b509aabce9c78e647ae

commit_message:
Move service validation to rbac_rule_validation

This patchset moves service validation helper function out of
policy_authority module into rbac_rule_validation, because
service validation should be placed in a high-level module
that covers both policy_authority and requirements_authority.

Additionally, the service validation logic is refactored
to use Tempest's get_service_list() under tempest.common.utils
because:

* this approach is configuration driven
* more efficient
* simpler
* uses supported Tempest function

The unit tests are also moved and refactored as appropriate.

Change-Id: I330e1e047e0be73b40d06a3c04caa204ab92d984

Mark raw strings as such

This is raising warnings now and will be an error in future versions of
Python 3.

Based off https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580633/1

to incorporate those that have recently been added to Neutron's
policy file (because they were missing):

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577471/5

This includes updating relevant tests with the following policies:

* "update_port:fixed_ips"
* "create_router:external_gateway_info"

"create_router:external_gateway_info:network_id"

The approach taken is to create new feature flags for the new
policies and apply them to existing tests. This makes it easier
to maintain the tests but does result in the tests getting
skipped for previous releases of OpenStack that don't have
these "newer" policies. However, it is unlikely that policy
will be changed for older releases of OpenStack.

The alternative approach is [1] which leads to a lot of test
maintenance overhead: each combination of the set of all
the policies enforced per test needs to be accounted for
across n, n-1, and n-2, which is quite difficult to maintain.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/584102/5

commit_message:
Update policies for some port/router network tests

This patch set updates policies for some port/router network tests
to incorporate those that have recently been added to Neutron's
policy file (because they were missing):

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577471/5

This includes updating relevant tests with the following policies:

* "create_port:fixed_ips"
* "update_port:fixed_ips"
* "create_router:external_gateway_info"

Also adds a new test for the following policy:

"create_router:external_gateway_info:network_id"

The approach taken is to create new feature flags for the new
policies and apply them to existing tests. This makes it easier
to maintain the tests but does result in the tests getting
skipped for previous releases of OpenStack that don't have
these "newer" policies. However, it is unlikely that policy
will be changed for older releases of OpenStack.

The alternative approach is [1] which leads to a lot of test
maintenance overhead: each combination of the set of all
the policies enforced per test needs to be accounted for
across n, n-1, and n-2, which is quite difficult to maintain.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/584102/5

Change-Id: I679fca4d10a0398cc66755ef428fa7b0bd77195d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/02/584102/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "create_router:external_gateway_info", "create_router:external_gateway_info", def test_create_router_external_gateway_fixed_ips(self): @rbac_rule_validation.action( service="neutron", rules=["create_router", "create_router:external_gateway_info", "create_router:external_gateway_info:network_id"], expected_error_codes=[404, 403, 403, 403]) @decorators.idempotent_id('f1fc5a23-e3d8-44f0-b7bc-47006ad9d3d4') def test_create_router_external_gateway_info_network_id(self): """Create Router External Gateway Info Network Id RBAC test for the neutron create_router:external_gateway_info:network_id policy """ name = data_utils.rand_name(self.__class__.__name__ + '-snat-router') external_gateway_info = {'network_id': self.network['id']} with self.rbac_utils.override_role(self): router = self.routers_client.create_router( name=name, external_gateway_info=external_gateway_info) self.addCleanup(self.routers_client.delete_router, router['router']['id'])

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-08 17:05:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/patrole/commit/e56bac32c6761f67ac27b40ecf57fc280a9ccae9', 'message': 'Add distinct conf opt groups for both validation methodologies

This patchset adds a distinct group for each of the validation
methodologies:

  * oslo.policy approach => policy_validation
  * custom requirements approach => requirements_validation

policy_validation receives the following options:

  * custom_policy_files

requirements_validation receives the following options:

  * custom_requirements_file
  * test_custom_requirements

Background: In the initial Patrole spec for project creation submitted
to qa-specs [0] there is much discussion about oslo.policy-driven vs.
requirements-driven approach to RBAC validation. Long story short:
Patrole by default does oslo.policy validation but later added
requirements-driven validation [1]. However, the options for both
ways of doing validation should be made as distinct as possible to
avoid confusion between which options to use for which validation
methods.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/382672/
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/477014/

commit_message:
Add distinct conf opt groups for both validation methodologies

This patchset adds a distinct group for each of the validation
methodologies:

  * oslo.policy approach => policy_validation
  * custom requirements approach => requirements_validation

policy_validation receives the following options:

  * custom_policy_files

requirements_validation receives the following options:

  * custom_requirements_file
  * test_custom_requirements

Background: In the initial Patrole spec for project creation submitted
to qa-specs [0] there is much discussion about oslo.policy-driven vs.
requirements-driven approach to RBAC validation. Long story short:
Patrole by default does oslo.policy validation but later added
requirements-driven validation [1]. However, the options for both
ways of doing validation should be made as distinct as possible to
avoid confusion between which options to use for which validation
methods.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/382672/
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/477014/

Change-Id: I2f3205976fb7f690f967cb30570ed9b1bec8293f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/68/580868/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for group, opts in pconfig.list_opts(): config.register_opt_group( conf, group, opts) return [(group.name, opts) for group, opts in pconfig.list_opts()]
deleted_lines: config.register_opt_group( conf, pconfig.patrole_group, pconfig.PatroleGroup) config.register_opt_group( conf, pconfig.patrole_log_group, pconfig.PatroleLogGroup) config.register_opt_group( conf, pconfig.policy_feature_enabled, pconfig.PolicyFeatureEnabledGroup) return [ (pconfig.patrole_group.name, pconfig.PatroleGroup), (pconfig.policy_feature_enabled.name, pconfig.PolicyFeatureEnabledGroup) ]

commit_message:
Improve unit tests for policy authority module

This patch set improves unit tests for policy authority module:

- adds better/more intuitive resource policy files
- adds tests for validating oslo.policy GenericCheck checks by
  passing in additional metadata

Change-Id: I7cf3a294a038268fe8fa3119981f282f782b2a74

subject: Added in JSON format for test report log, and ability to prevent deleting the log between runs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-11-20 23:26:43.000000000', 'files': ['patrole_tempest_plugin/rbac_rule_validation.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/config.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/plugin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/patrole/commit/ecf2d464bed3c43bc5f56d96a36e0f1f261b8cb7', 'message': 'Added in JSON format for test report log, and ability to prevent
deleting the log between runs

Added Role as a variable to be printed in the report log

Added in 2 new variables:
report_log_format: text (the default) or JSON
  In JSON format, the log will print the test results as a JSON
  object rather than a plaintext string

  Example:
  [Role]: admin, [Service]: nova, [Test]: test_create_agent, [Rules]:
os_compute_api:os-agents, [Expected]: Allowed, [Actual]: Allowed
  vs
  {"role": "admin", "service": "nova", "test": "test_create_agent",
"rules": "os_compute_api:os-agents", "expected": "Allowed", "actual":
"Allowed"}

  In the case where another string is present, the behavior
  defaults to the text-based line display

remove_log_on_run: True (the default) or False
  Controls whether or not to remove the log file on each invocation
  of tempest. This can be useful to preserve when multiple invocations
  are needed, to test multiple roles for example

Change-Id: I7a302e571f4fb5ffb33287c8153be7f8b8e38dc8
'}]
commit_message:
Added in JSON format for test report log, and ability to prevent
deleting the log between runs

Added Role as a variable to be printed in the report log

Added in 2 new variables:
report_log_format: text (the default) or JSON
  In JSON format, the log will print the test results as a JSON
  object rather than a plaintext string

  Example:
  [Role]: admin, [Service]: nova, [Test]: test_create_agent, [Rules]:
os_compute_api:os-agents, [Expected]: Allowed, [Actual]: Allowed
  vs
  {"role": "admin", "service": "nova", "test": "test_create_agent",
"rules": "os_compute_api:os-agents", "expected": "Allowed", "actual":
"Allowed"}

  In the case where another string is present, the behavior
  defaults to the text-based line display

remove_log_on_run: True (the default) or False
  Controls whether or not to remove the log file on each invocation
  of tempest. This can be useful to preserve when multiple invocations
  are needed, to test multiple roles for example

Change-Id: I7a302e571f4fb5ffb33287c8153be7f8b8e38dc8

commit_message:
Enable sphinx.ext.intersphinx for tempest

This package is used for automatic generation of links
to the documentation of objects in other projects.

Adding a mapping for the Tempest  makes it possible to
convert a reference like :py:class:`tempest.test.BaseTestCase`
to the link:
https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/library/code/tempest.test.html#tempest.test.BaseTestCase

Depends-On: I9a843ea024e71fbb377de5aa57cedafdd456269d

Change-Id: I946e78d4360a273e7fac23ac2cf879acb613da66

commit_message:
Role usage refactoring

Loading roles from config in one place. Fixing the issue with loading
roles from rbac_test_role and rbac_test_roles options.
Checking for admin role moved into RbacUtilsMixin class. In a stage when
the _init_roles is called It verifies the admin role ID for all roles,
including implied roles.
Added an ability to restore original roles if used pre-provisioned
credentials.
Modifying the PolicyAutority for taking a test_object to use is_admin
function in the _is_admin_context function.

TODO:
* unit tests
* functional test for pre-provisioned credentials ??? if i will figure
  out how to do this.

Change-Id: I4add0d24548163254f0e3051b38391dfe9948c28

commit_message:
Support both rbac_test_role and rbac_test_roles
in tempest.conf.
Resolved, user is assigned admin role irrespective of what value is given
to rbac_test_role in tempest.conf

Change-Id: Ie74525ce4c43c1a7d9bfec7cfd21926e90826d74

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/index.html#remove-rule-from-firewall-policy

commit_message:
Add missing FWaaS tests

Missing policies:
* `insert_rule` for "Insert rule into a firewall policy" action [0]
* `remove_rule` for "Remove rule from firewall policy" action [1]

[0] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/index.html#id370
[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/index.html#id375

Depends-On: I979edd26264ae5f9ceab2da350bc99c40145ec40
Story: 2002641
Task: 22310

added_lines: class BaseFWaaSV2PluginRbacTest(BaseNetworkRbacTest): """Base class to be used with tests that require FWaaS v2 extension """ @classmethod def skip_checks(cls): super(BaseFWaaSV2PluginRbacTest, cls).skip_checks() if not cls.is_fwaas_plugin_avaliable(): msg = ("FWaaS v2 Extension not installed.") raise cls.skipException(msg) @classmethod def is_fwaas_plugin_avaliable(cls): try: import neutron_fwaas # noqa return True except ImportError: return False @classmethod def _create_client(cls, klass, manager): return klass( manager.auth_provider, CONF.network.catalog_type, CONF.network.region or CONF.identity.region, endpoint_type=CONF.network.endpoint_type, build_interval=CONF.network.build_interval, build_timeout=CONF.network.build_timeout, **manager.default_params) @classmethod def get_client_manager(cls, credential_type=None, roles=None, force_new=None): manager = super(BaseFWaaSV2PluginRbacTest, cls).get_client_manager( credential_type=credential_type, roles=roles, force_new=force_new ) # Create FWaaS v2 clients if cls.is_fwaas_plugin_avaliable(): from neutron_fwaas.tests.tempest_plugin.services import v2_client cls.fwaas_groups_client = cls._create_client( v2_client.FirewallGroupsClient, manager) cls.fwaas_policies_client = cls._create_client( v2_client.FirewallPoliciesClient, manager) cls.fwaas_rules_client = cls._create_client( v2_client.FirewallRulesClient, manager) return manager

commit_message:
Allow testing of neutron plugins

Added a subclass of policy_authority to allow Neutron extensions to
be tested with Patrole, with the expectation that these tests would
live in the Neutron plugins, as in tempest plugins for the
Neutron extensions.

Depends-on: I498c637da9dac7605851b2edbbfb302103c3d6a9

Change-Id: I13e1b4223cff5efe008cb7207304a51d04e7a6ec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/94/659894/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add tests to cover segment_id attribute in subnets

Test gets and creates subnets with assigned segment [0].
Part of "Increase Neutron RBAC Coverage" initiative [1].

'create_subnet:segment_id'
'get_subnet:segment_id'

[0] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/index.html#segments
[1] https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2002641

Story: 2002641
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/584601/
Change-Id: I5606b833a46e3b548e44daf236d2f5b357859abd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/88/582388/30 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import netaddr @utils.requires_ext(extension='segment', service='network') @decorators.idempotent_id('c02618e7-bb20-1a3a-83c8-6eec2af08752') @rbac_rule_validation.action(service="neutron", rule="get_subnet:segment_id") def test_show_subnet_with_segment_id(self): """Show subnet with segment_id. RBAC test for the neutron "get_subnet:segment_id" policy """ net = self.create_network() self.addCleanup(self.networks_client.delete_network, net['id']) seg = self.segments_client.create_segment(network_id=net['id'], network_type="gre", segmentation_id=1234) self.addCleanup( self.segments_client.delete_segment, seg['segment']['id']) subnet = self.create_subnet(net, segment_id=seg['segment']['id'], cidr=netaddr.IPNetwork("172.25.123.0/24"), mask_bits=24) self.addCleanup(self.subnets_client.delete_subnet, subnet['id']) with self.rbac_utils.override_role(self): self.subnets_client.show_subnet(self.subnet['id']) @utils.requires_ext(extension='segment', service='network') @decorators.idempotent_id('c02618e7-bb20-1a3b-83c8-6eec2af08753') @rbac_rule_validation.action(service="neutron", rule="create_subnet:segment_id") def test_create_subnet_with_segment_id(self): """Create subnet with segment_id. RBAC test for the neutron "create_subnet:segment_id" policy """ net = self.create_network() self.addCleanup(self.networks_client.delete_network, net['id']) seg = self.segments_client.create_segment(network_id=net['id'], network_type="gre", segmentation_id=1234) self.addCleanup( self.segments_client.delete_segment, seg['segment']['id']) with self.rbac_utils.override_role(self): subnet = self.create_subnet( net, segment_id=seg['segment']['id'], cidr=netaddr.IPNetwork("172.25.123.0/24"), mask_bits=24) self.addCleanup(self.subnets_client.delete_subnet, subnet['id'])

added_lines: @decorators.idempotent_id('0481adeb-7465-44d5-543c-35910cc18a6c') @rbac_rule_validation.action(service="neutron", rules=["create_subnet", "create_subnet:service_types"]) def test_create_subnet_with_service_type(self): """Create subnet with service_type. RBAC test for the neutron "create_subnet:service_types" policy """ with self.rbac_utils.override_role(self): self.create_subnet( self.network, service_types=["network:floatingip_agent_gateway"]) @decorators.idempotent_id('f36cd821-aa11-4bd0-b43d-110fc4b553eb') @rbac_rule_validation.action(service="neutron", rules=[ "update_subnet", "update_subnet:service_types"], expected_error_codes=[403, 403]) def test_update_subnet_with_service_type(self): """Update subnet with service_type. RBAC test for the neutron "update_subnet:service_types" policy """ with self.rbac_utils.override_role(self): self.subnets_client.update_subnet( self.subnet['id'], service_types=["network:floatingip_agent_gateway"])

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-16 16:02:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/patrole/commit/5cd43821446fb4f4d72d88e67925db4556f90d24', 'message': 'Fix 'use_dynamic_credentials = false' with Neutron extension tests

commit_message:
Fix 'use_dynamic_credentials = false' with Neutron extension tests

When running Neutron extension tests and Tempest configured with
'use_dynamic_credentials = false' the user_id and tenant_id are unset
and results in the tests not being executed: "Could not find user: None."

Both user_id and tenant_id are needed in rbac_utils [0].

[0] https://github.com/openstack/patrole/blob/master/patrole_tempest_plugin/rbac_utils.py#L163

Change-Id: I88d0624bc279b004ebe5f721cdef5adf12bd0ed9

added_lines: # user_id and tenant_id are lost when calling the clients.Manager user_id = manager.credentials.user_id tenant_id = manager.credentials.tenant_id # Add the user_id and tenant_id back to the the manager.credentials as # this is lost when calling the clients.Manager. commit_message:
Fix resource leak from 'test_create_image_from_volume_backed_server'

'test_create_image_from_volume_backed_server' causes two volumes and one
volume snapshot to be leaked:
 - leak from the attached volume
 - leak from a volume that is created using the image in the tempest.conf
 - leak from a volume snapshot that is created from the attached volume

Change-Id: I2c1a1db8215bd054818ec447afdc02815e9994a4

commit_message:
Retrying create_test_server

Zuul jobs fails very often with errors at creating an object,
presumably this can be resolved by retry a call.

Add `retry` function to RbaccUtils class.
Add `retry` config option.
Override the `create_test_server` function to use `retry`.

Change-Id: Ifad316364eaa9ad0d2885a9fbc7a81024d1b13c8
Story: 2004369
Task: 27972
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/29/642829/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_log import log as loggingLOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) @classmethod def retry(cls, func, **kwargs): for i in range(5): try: return func(**kwargs) except Exception as e: LOG.exception("Retry #%d out of %d function '%s'. " "Exception: %s", i + 1, 5, func.__name__, e) @classmethod def create_test_server(cls, **kwargs): return cls.retry(super(BaseV2ComputeRbacTest, cls).create_test_server, **kwargs)

commit_message:
Add support for reading custom YAML policy files

Currently, Patrole supports reading custom JSON policy files, but
not YAML files, the standard policy file extension since Ocata [0].

This commit adds support for Patrole to read YAML policy files in
addition to JSON policy files. The option ``custom_policy_files`` was
changed so that each policy path included must match the following
regular expression:

    r'^[^%]*%s[^%]*\.(json|yaml|yml)$'

This supports the following types of paths, for example:

    * /foo/bar/service/policy.json
    * /foo/bar/service/policy.yaml
    * /foo/bar/service/policy.yml
    * /foo/service.json
    * /foo/service.yaml
    * /foo/service.yml

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/ocata/config-reference/policy-yaml-file.html

Change-Id: I81f1c721da441b4e5da9ae31042aabe7a9e3de45
Closes-Bug: #1710965
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/68/494368/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import yamlfrom oslo_serialization import jsonutils as json file_ext = os.path.splitext(self.path)[1] supported_extensions = ['.json', '.yaml', '.yml'] temp_file_data = policy_file.read() # If the file extension is yaml-like then attempt to parse the # YAML data. Else if the file extension is .json attempt to # parse the JSON data. if file_ext in supported_extensions[1:]: file_policy_data = yaml.safe_load(temp_file_data) elif file_ext == supported_extensions[0]: file_policy_data = json.loads(temp_file_data) except (IOError, ValueError, yaml.YAMLError) as e: msg += ( "%s file must be valid YAML or JSON file and end " "in a supported extension: %s." % ( file_ext[1:].upper() if file_ext else 'Unknown', supported_extensions)) LOG.error(msg)
deleted_lines: import json file_policy_data = policy_file.read() file_policy_data = json.loads(file_policy_data) except (IOError, ValueError) as e: msg += "JSON may be improperly formatted." LOG.debug(msg) file_policy_data = {}

subject: Restore credentials after test termination with pre-prov creds
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-01 04:38:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/patrole/commit/25dee355ab0dea502b70734ed75ffff26695b887', 'message': '[WIP] Restore credentials after test termination with pre-prov creds

Currently, Patrole switches the role for the primary Tempest creds
in order to do RBAC testing validation. This is a harmless act
when using dynamic credentials, as they are deleted after test
execution anyway.

However, when using pre-provisioned credentials, this means that the
roles for the set of credentials included in the accounts.yaml file
is permanently changed -- even after test execution. The credentials
in the accounts.yaml acquire the test role defined by `[patrole]
rbac_test_role` but lose the original roles before running any
Patrole tests. This means that it is entirely possible that the
roles enumerated in the accounts.yaml may be wrong after test
execution. Thus, Patrole testing can cause the pre-provisioned
credentials to behave unexpectedly when running, for example,
regular Tempest tests using the same credentials.

Because this behavior is undesirable, Patrole should restore any
credentials changed during test execution after test execution
using the `atexit` module which calls the `_restore_credentials`
callback on interpreter termination.

Note that this is not a bulletproof solution because, as the `atexit`
docs mention [0]:

  The functions registered via this module are not called when the
  program is killed by a signal not handled by Python, when a Python
  fatal internal error is detected, or when os._exit() is called.

Under normal circumstances, however, this commit ensures that the
credentials that are modified during test execution are restored
to their original values if pre-provisioned credentials are set up
in tempest.conf.

Note that this behavior can best be confirmed when using one set
of primary/admin creds in the accounts.yaml file and running the
tests serially so that the creds that are modified belong to the
only Member-role creds defined in the accounts.yaml file.

[0] https://docs.python.org/2/library/atexit.html

Change-Id: I669106422a264b6550f5bbfbf16dc2d47f7a71d8
Closes-Bug: #1714413
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-09-01 04:39:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/patrole/commit/97db4d81786ee33acab7f4f7eda0507a24fe6e95', 'message': '[WIP] Restore credentials after test termination with pre-prov creds

Currently, Patrole switches the role for the primary Tempest creds
in order to do RBAC testing validation. This is a harmless act
when using dynamic credentials, as they are deleted after test
execution anyway.

However, when using pre-provisioned credentials, this means that the
roles for the set of credentials included in the accounts.yaml file
is permanently changed -- even after test execution. The credentials
in the accounts.yaml acquire the test role defined by `[patrole]
rbac_test_role` but lose their original roles after running any
Patrole tests. This means that it is entirely possible that the
roles enumerated in the accounts.yaml may be wrong after test
execution. Thus, Patrole testing can cause the pre-provisioned
credentials to behave unexpectedly when running, for example,
regular Tempest tests using the same credentials.

Because this behavior is undesirable, Patrole should restore any
credentials changed during test execution after test execution
using the `atexit` module which calls the `_restore_credentials`
callback on interpreter termination.

Note that this is not a bulletproof solution because, as the `atexit`
docs mention [0]:

  The functions registered via this module are not called when the
  program is killed by a signal not handled by Python, when a Python
  fatal internal error is detected, or when os._exit() is called.

Under normal circumstances, however, this commit ensures that the
credentials that are modified during test execution are restored
to their original values if pre-provisioned credentials are set up
in tempest.conf.

Note that this behavior can best be confirmed when using one set
of primary/admin creds in the accounts.yaml file and running the
tests serially so that the creds that are modified belong to the
only Member-role creds defined in the accounts.yaml file.

[0] https://docs.python.org/2/library/atexit.html

Change-Id: I669106422a264b6550f5bbfbf16dc2d47f7a71d8
Closes-Bug: #1714413

commit_message:
Restore credentials after test termination with pre-prov creds

Currently, Patrole switches the role for the primary Tempest creds
in order to do RBAC testing validation. This is a harmless act
when using dynamic credentials, as they are deleted after test
execution anyway.

However, when using pre-provisioned credentials, this means that the
roles for the set of credentials included in the accounts.yaml file
is permanently changed -- even after test execution. The credentials
in the accounts.yaml acquire the test role defined by `[patrole]
rbac_test_role` but lose the original roles before running any
Patrole tests. This means that it is entirely possible that the
roles enumerated in the accounts.yaml may be wrong after test
execution. Thus, Patrole testing can cause the pre-provisioned
credentials to behave unexpectedly when running, for example,
regular Tempest tests using the same credentials.

Because this behavior is undesirable, Patrole should restore any
credentials changed during test execution after test execution
using the `atexit` module which calls the `_restore_credentials`
callback on interpreter termination.

Note that this is not a bulletproof solution because, as the `atexit`
docs mention [0]:

  The functions registered via this module are not called when the
  program is killed by a signal not handled by Python, when a Python
  fatal internal error is detected, or when os._exit() is called.

Under normal circumstances, however, this commit ensures that the
credentials that are modified during test execution are restored
to their original values if pre-provisioned credentials are set up
in tempest.conf.

Note that this behavior can best be confirmed when using one set
of primary/admin creds in the accounts.yaml file and running the
tests serially so that the creds that are modified belong to the
only Member-role creds defined in the accounts.yaml file.

[0] https://docs.python.org/2/library/atexit.html

Change-Id: I669106422a264b6550f5bbfbf16dc2d47f7a71d8
Closes-Bug: #1714413
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/85/499885/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import atexit_ORIGINAL_ROLES = {} def _get_admin_roles_client(test_obj=None): # Get admin roles client for switching roles. The credentials used to # instantiate the manager are the default Tempest admin credentials in # `[auth]` config group. This function is also called by `atexit` via # `_restore_credentials`, so fallback to `auth_version` in config since the # `test_obj` will not be available during interpreter termination. identity_version = (test_obj.get_identity_version() if test_obj else CONF.identity.auth_version) admin_mgr = clients.Manager( credentials.get_configured_admin_credentials()) if identity_version == 'v3': admin_roles_client = admin_mgr.roles_v3_client else: admin_roles_client = admin_mgr.roles_client return admin_roles_client def _restore_credentials(): # Role switching is used by `RbacUtils` to switch credentials for # `os_primary`. With dynamic credentials, it does not matter if the creds # aren't restored to their original values as dynamic creds are destroyed # anyway. But with pre-provisioned credentials, the creds should be # restored to their original values following test termination. admin_roles_client = _get_admin_roles_client() for (project_id, user_id), orig_role_ids in _ORIGINAL_ROLES.items(): current_roles = admin_roles_client.list_user_roles_on_project( project_id, user_id)['roles'] current_role_ids = [role['id'] for role in current_roles] for role_id in current_role_ids: admin_roles_client.delete_role_from_user_on_project( project_id, user_id, role_id) for role_id in orig_role_ids: admin_roles_client.create_user_role_on_project( project_id, user_id, role_id) def __init__(self, test_obj): """Constructor for ``RbacUtils``. :param test_obj: An instance of `tempest.test.BaseTestCase`. # Intialize the admin roles_client to perform role switching. self.admin_roles_client = _get_admin_roles_client(test_obj) self.switch_role(test_obj, toggle_rbac_role=False) if (self.project_id, self.user_id) not in _ORIGINAL_ROLES: _ORIGINAL_ROLES.setdefault((self.project_id, self.user_id), role_ids) def _get_roles_by_name(self): if not all([admin_role_id, rbac_role_id]): msg = ("Roles defined by `[patrole] rbac_test_role` and " "`[identity] admin_role` must be defined in the system.") def switch_role(self, test_obj, toggle_rbac_role=False): """Switch the role used by `os_primary` Tempest credentials. Switch the role used by `os_primary` credentials to: * admin if `toggle_rbac_role` is False * `CONF.patrole.rbac_test_role` if `toggle_rbac_role` is True :param test_obj: test object of type tempest.lib.base.BaseTestCase :param toggle_rbac_role: role to switch `os_primary` Tempest creds to """ self.user_id = test_obj.os_primary.credentials.user_id self.project_id = test_obj.os_primary.credentials.tenant_id self.token = test_obj.os_primary.auth_provider.get_token() LOG.debug('Switching role to: %s.', toggle_rbac_role) role_already_present = False try: if not all([self.admin_role_id, self.rbac_role_id]): self._get_roles_by_name() self._validate_switch_role(test_obj, toggle_rbac_role) target_role = ( self.rbac_role_id if toggle_rbac_role else self.admin_role_id) role_already_present = self._list_and_clear_user_roles_on_project( target_role) # Do not switch roles if `target_role` already exists. if not role_already_present: self._create_user_role_on_project(target_role) except Exception as exp: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.exception(exp) finally: test_obj.os_primary.auth_provider.clear_auth() # Fernet tokens are not subsecond aware so sleep to ensure we are # passing the second boundary before attempting to authenticate. # Only sleep if a token revocation occurred as a result of role # switching. This will optimize test runtime in the case where # ``[identity] admin_role`` == ``[rbac] rbac_test_role``. if not role_already_present: time.sleep(1) test_obj.os_primary.auth_provider.set_auth() # Only restore the credentials if using pre-provisioned credentials following # test termination. if CONF.auth.test_accounts_file: atexit.register(_restore_credentials)

commit_message:
Remove users with system scope from roles dict

For users with system scope keystone could return empty endpoints
in catalog in response to token issue request. Catalog content
is used in tests, for example in tempest.api.volume.admin.
test_volume_quotas_negative.VolumeQuotasNegativeTestJSON. If we use
tempest static creds and system scoped creds are picked up for test
mentioned above it will lead to error. Proposed fix remove accounts
with system scope frome roles part of hash_dict.

Closes-Bug: 2004261
Change-Id: I0ab5698c86d61ccbf959f3a71025794bcb51ed0e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/43/872343/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if scope != 'system': hash_dict = cls._append_role( role, temp_hash_key, hash_dict)

commit_message:
Support --os-key option

keystoneclient Session expects as cert argument, one of the followings:
 * None (no client certificate),
 * a path to client certificate,
 * a tuple with client certificate/key paths.

The change updates manilaclient code to support the last case (ie:
os_cert and os_key are non-empty) with the --os-key option
and OS_KEY environment variable.

Closes-Bug: #1999775
Change-Id: I09313b7c55a5f9d4ec032a37e69a1d79db29d648
(cherry picked from commit 43943fdf670328e2fe606c07949190e9e45063ae)
(cherry picked from commit 8d9ea26f56b82044aa74fab669225df47143068e)
(cherry picked from commit 7acf31c62b5b66899aef6c76800c2088d130da7a)
(cherry picked from commit e2a4886d7f7e1fc14d44775d662c48fed94e78a0)

commit_message:
Rename setup-mtu-t1 argument because it is misleading

setup-mtu-t1 argument name is misleading as it suggest that
it will do something with the MTU value, but it really just reduces
DHCP agent t1 timer. The fact that this commnad will have a side
effect of getting a new MTU value from DHCP should not be part
of the argument name. This is based on customer's feedback.
I am keeping backward compatibility for setup-mtu-t1 argument
in order not to break any existing tools that might depend on it.

subject: nova-scheduler: Encourage weighers to spread
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-10 22:03:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/weights/cpu.py', 'nova/scheduler/weights/ram.py', 'nova/scheduler/weights/disk.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/1a5c0bad095392a0654037c5f6bd1d22aceda9e6', 'message': 'nova-scheduler: Encourage weighers to spread

Many of the resource weighers in Nova (CPU, disk, RAM)
encourage "stacking" of allocations instead of "spreading"
in heterogeneous environments.

That is to say, the weighers preferentially keep assigning
greater weights to the hypervisors with most free resources
by absolute value. In extreme cases, this result in some
some hypervisors going into logical resource overcommit
before other hypervisors have a single allocation assigned
to them.

To encourage spreading in heterogeneous environments,
resource weighing (and normalization) really needs to occur
with respect to the utilization of each host as a percent
value. Hence this commit, which changes the behavior of the
impacted weighers accordingly.

Signed-off-by: Tyler Stachecki <tstachecki@bloomberg.net>
Change-Id: I9e4973e2b88af9fe29378878e00873ab4004adcc
Closes-Bug: 2011127
'}]
commit_message:
nova-scheduler: Encourage weighers to spread

Many of the resource weighers in Nova (CPU, disk, RAM)
encourage "stacking" of allocations instead of "spreading"
in heterogeneous environments.

That is to say, the weighers preferentially keep assigning
greater weights to the hypervisors with most free resources
by absolute value. In extreme cases, this result in some
some hypervisors going into logical resource overcommit
before other hypervisors have a single allocation assigned
to them.

To encourage spreading in heterogeneous environments,
resource weighing (and normalization) really needs to occur
with respect to the utilization of each host as a percent
value. Hence this commit, which changes the behavior of the
impacted weighers accordingly.

Signed-off-by: Tyler Stachecki <tstachecki@bloomberg.net>
Change-Id: I9e4973e2b88af9fe29378878e00873ab4004adcc
Closes-Bug: 2011127

commit_message:
Fix ceph pool creation failure

During `openstack overcloud deploy`, ceph create pool operation
fails on RHSCSv6 as the podman command generated by 'ceph_pool'
ansible module has the volume argument as /etc/ceph.

This patch ensures to use the '/var/lib/ceph/$FSID/config/'
in the podman command generated by all the ansible moduels.

Even the 'tripleo_cephadm_ceph_cli' is updated to use the
new path.

Resolves: rhbz#2172582
Change-Id: I570ce859c3033d0f8cc36064f851419fca1a9d66
(cherry picked from commit 0c3a54a6efa9c0e320e949e251f25f72f5a489de)

commit_message:
[OVN] Method ``get_port_qos`` should always return 2 values

The method ``neutron.agent.ovn.agent.ovsdb.get_port_qos`` should
always return 2 values, even when the LSP is not present. This
patch:
* fixes the output, returning 2 values
* catches the exception raised when the LSP is not present in the
  OVN NB database
* returns the default max_kbps and min_kbps values (0, 0).

Closes-Bug: #2009804
Change-Id: I03ea78fcc5825e35c07dda1aa790769aa918dd8a
(cherry picked from commit bffa642b351f7fc3bb5cfb7a1bb2a3499c4b4506)

subject: Revert "Run virtqemud with umask 0027"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-02-21 13:38:43.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/nova/nova-modular-libvirt-container-puppet.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/1002a67e6d3298ffaa50cbb17391dda27a6f3fce', 'message': 'Revert "Run virtqemud with umask 0027"

This reverts commit 7bba86fc582b6d599117be06c23d0a3d91332cfd.

Reason for revert: Fix regression for virtqemud is started with umask of 0027 which then gets in the way libvirt sets up hugepages. In this particular case, libvirtd/virtqemud creates $hugetlbfs/libvirt/qemu/ (/dev/hugepages/libvirt/qemu/ in this case) which is meant as top level directory, a base where individual, per-guest directories are then created. Now, the top level directory is owned by root:root (so that nobody else can modify its perms) but we also want it to be accessible by other processes (mind you, we don't need to list the directory (o+r), we need to be able to access subdirs (o+x)).

Setting such restrictive umask for a process that is supposed to prepare environment for other users (QEMU runs under qemu:qemu) was a bad choice because of that, hence this revert

Change-Id: I75897fbaf7d9415178bc267c848b83775a384814
Related: rhbz#2166979
(cherry picked from commit 88ab470d82b4efcaa1582474d4b5bc087f437cd9)
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Run virtqemud with umask 0027"

This reverts commit 7bba86fc582b6d599117be06c23d0a3d91332cfd.

Reason for revert: Fix regression for virtqemud is started with umask of 0027 which then gets in the way libvirt sets up hugepages. In this particular case, libvirtd/virtqemud creates $hugetlbfs/libvirt/qemu/ (/dev/hugepages/libvirt/qemu/ in this case) which is meant as top level directory, a base where individual, per-guest directories are then created. Now, the top level directory is owned by root:root (so that nobody else can modify its perms) but we also want it to be accessible by other processes (mind you, we don't need to list the directory (o+r), we need to be able to access subdirs (o+x)).

Setting such restrictive umask for a process that is supposed to prepare environment for other users (QEMU runs under qemu:qemu) was a bad choice because of that, hence this revert

Change-Id: I75897fbaf7d9415178bc267c848b83775a384814
Related: rhbz#2166979
(cherry picked from commit 88ab470d82b4efcaa1582474d4b5bc087f437cd9)

commit_message:
Add Antelope support

* sync charm-helpers to classic charms
* change openstack-origin/source default to antelope
* align testing with antelope
* add new antelope bundles
* add antelope bundles to tests.yaml
* add antelope tests to osci.yaml and .zuul.yaml
* update build-on and run-on bases

Change-Id: I733a6c785ef76b602a6d4950403abbd31da6a03b

commit_message:
Rename setup-mtu-t1 argument because it is misleading

setup-mtu-t1 argument name is misleading as it suggest that
it will do something with the MTU value, but it really just reduces
DHCP agent t1 timer. The fact that this commnad will have a side
effect of getting a new MTU value from DHCP should not be part
of the argument name. This is based on customer's feedback.
I am keeping backward compatibility for setup-mtu-t1 argument
in order not to break any existing tools that might depend on it.

Change-Id: I939b21fa998c80cf921efeae3e8fa8c2b4ef4f50
(cherry picked from commit c2fb0b16b66b69c48a8e6d9d304f0efe851d7566)

commit_message:
Rename setup-mtu-t1 argument because it is misleading

setup-mtu-t1 argument name is misleading as it suggest that
it will do something with the MTU value, but it really just reduces
DHCP agent t1 timer. The fact that this commnad will have a side
effect of getting a new MTU value from DHCP should not be part
of the argument name. This is based on customer's feedback.
I am keeping backward compatibility for setup-mtu-t1 argument
in order not to break any existing tools that might depend on it.

Change-Id: I939b21fa998c80cf921efeae3e8fa8c2b4ef4f50
(cherry picked from commit c2fb0b16b66b69c48a8e6d9d304f0efe851d7566)

commit_message:
Add Antelope support

* Add new antelope bundles
* Drop focal and kinetic bundles
* Drop jammy-yoga bundle
* Use generic job templates in osci.yaml
* Update build-on and run-on bases
* Amend path to built charm
* Add .zuul.yaml
* Add .gitreview file
* passenv OS_* and TEST_* env variables
* Update allowlist_externals

Change-Id: Ib2b1713198cc0daaff81cf7738e4623c5d965a46
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ironic-dashboard refs/changes/02/877102/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: bash -c "if [ ! -f ./*.charm ]; then echo 'Charm does not exist. Run tox -e build'; exit 1; fi"
deleted_lines: bash -c "if [ ! -f ../*.charm ]; then echo 'Charm does not exist. Run tox -e build'; exit 1; fi"

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-11 11:21:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/0082c6a901a6f0d5c2b74a0d6b59a4a840f55272', 'message': "Add support for shared os_brick file lock path

commit_message:
Add support for shared os_brick file lock path

There can be problems with some os-brick connectors if nova and cinder
run on the same host with different lock path locations, which we
currently do, or if Cinder and Glance with cinder store run on the same
host, and a recent os-brick change
(Ic52338278eb5bb3d90ce582fe6b23f37eb5568c4) allows for an os-brick
specific lock_path to facilitate these kind of deployment.

This patch adds the ``lock_path`` configuration option in the
``[os_brick]`` section of the nova, cinder, and glance config files.

If the os-brick, cinder, nova, or glance-store changes are not present
then the new config option is be ignored in the respective service, and
it will be used otherwise, so there's no need to make this patch
dependent on any other since we won't be worse off than we are now.

Change-Id: Ibe7da160460151734224863cddec5e0d549b4938
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/29/849329/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add Antelope support

* sync charm-helpers to classic charms
* change openstack-origin/source default to antelope
* align testing with antelope
* add new antelope bundles
* add antelope bundles to tests.yaml
* add antelope tests to osci.yaml and .zuul.yaml
* update build-on and run-on bases

Change-Id: Ibceaa9d30d3d4a9a4e67fe5e45446b94f1d2e064

commit_message:
Add Antelope support

* sync charm-helpers to classic charms
* change openstack-origin/source default to antelope
* align testing with antelope
* add new antelope bundles
* add antelope bundles to tests.yaml
* add antelope tests to osci.yaml and .zuul.yaml
* update build-on and run-on bases

Change-Id: I698b89d2c4dfff7b667a810a42adda665773a5ce

commit_message:
Restructure the inspector module in preparation for its expansion

Converts ironic.drivers.modules.inspector into a package with
two subpackages: client and interface, the latter containing most
of the current content.

Change-Id: Idbfd275c60a873e3de2e0a34db793619f8c99d85

commit_message:
Add a non-voting metal3 CI job

We'll use only one node as we're limited in resources but that
should suffice for a basic test.

Change-Id: I8e845d46ba0e13027aa1e628b0ad45eb24f9b387

commit_message:
[FIPS] Install nettle-3.8-3.el9 in tcib base container

This patch adds installation of nettle-3.8-3.el9 to replace the rhel-9.0
version of the package, since 'dnf udpate' doesn't replace it.
The rhel-9.0 version of this package fails when running under FIPS.
When we get a new version o nettle in centos mirrors, the 'dnf update'
shall install a new version of the package and the workaround can be
remove.
We can't add a condition to install only when fips is enabled, since
build containers job doesn't run under fips enabled mode.

Related-Bug: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2154924
Related-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1984237
Change-Id: I4817edd840043a93e23612227910bd7e4fce85c4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/51/876751/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO: Temporary pinning nettle to 3.8-3.el9, so it can be reinstalled from centos-9 repos. # nettle-3.8-3 is already installed in ubi9 image, but it conflicts with newer versions on gnutls # installed from centos-9 repos. This workaround can be reverted once ubi9.2 is released, which # should contain a newer version of gnutls with fixes to run under FIPS mode. # See: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2154924 and # https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1984237 - run: >- if [ '{{ tcib_release }}' == '9' ];then dnf -y install nettle-3.8-3.el9; fi

commit_message:
Add Antelope support

* sync charm-helpers to classic charms
* change openstack-origin/source default to antelope
* align testing with antelope
* add new antelope bundles
* add antelope bundles to tests.yaml
* add antelope tests to osci.yaml and .zuul.yaml
* update build-on and run-on bases

Change-Id: I82117a2cbf8bf7145384f3b7255b7b7c6fb15844

Enable horizon in scenario005

... so that we can test manila-dsahboard deployment.

commit_message:
Replace murano::application

The defined type is being deprecated because it's just redundant.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-murano/+/873876
Change-Id: Ib6d573cf5b7f73dc53f3814b51bb80a1d5d6cf98
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration refs/changes/77/873877/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $application_package_path = $::osfamily ? { 'RedHat' => '/var/cache/murano/meta', default => '/usr/share/murano-common', } -> murano_application { 'io.murano': package_path => "${application_package_path}/io.murano.zip", }
